instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V4_G3H: What is PP3V4_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V3_G3H When you see PP3V4_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V3_G3H.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V PPbus
threads.message:
This mac had short <CAPACITOR>C7131</CAPACITOR>, I replaced it but with no result.
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, AND <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.
When I removed F7140, there is no voltage on either side.

<SIGNAL>PP3V4_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,4; PPbus ~0,92V;  PPDCIN 16,65V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V PPbus
threads.message: What is the actual voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7131</CAPACITOR>?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V PPbus
threads.message:
Now post <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> voltages.
Use <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/85 ast test points.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V PPbus
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V PPbus
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, is bad.
Be sure no short to ground at <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>.

threads.message:
replaces it, same result.
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 79357, member: 682"]
Certifique-se de que n√£o haja curto para o aterramento em <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>.
[/QUOTE]
There is no short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1V PPbus
threads.message:
Did you check the trace between <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>?

"2-16,68V
---------------
3- 6,77 V"
Do you know how a MOSFET P-channel works???
Because these readings imply to get same pin 2 voltage into pin 4.
Please check again and be sure to post accurate information.
